description.p: There are some who toe the line between artificery and magic, manipulating the Wave through symbols of binding and protection. They specialize in crafting arcane glyphs which ward against harm, and while they are known by many names across many cultures, they're most commonly referred to as Sigilists.

description.p: You gain the ability to Inscribe items with various sigils of protection
Over the course of a short rest, you can Inscribe a number of wards equal to half your proficiency bonus. The total number of Inscribed wards can't exceed your proficiency bonus.
A friendly creature with the ward on their person becomes its Bearer and gains benefits from its protection. When you Inscribe a ward, choose one of the following benefits.

ul.li: Choose a skill or tool proficiency. Whenever the bearer makes an skill or tool check for the skill or tool you chose they may add a d4 to the roll.
Choose a damage type. Damage dealt by the bearer overcomes resistances to this type of damage.
Choose an artificer spell of a level for which you have spell slots. The bearer may use their spell slots to cast this spell at the inscribed level or higher.

description.p: Additionally, when the bearer of a ward is hit by an attack or fails a saving throw, you may use your reaction to destroy the ward in a burst of protective magic. Until the start of the Bearer's next turn, attack rolls against the Bearer have disadvantage.
Inscribed Wards fade after 24 hours if they are not destroyed beforehand.

description.p: Once per turn, when you damage a creature with an Artificer cantrip, you may use your bonus action to temporarily mark it with a disrupting sigil. Until the start of your next turn, whenever that creature makes an attack roll or saving throw they subtract a d4 from the roll. You may do this a number of times equal to your intelligence modifier per short rest.

description.p: Your skill with creating magical sigils increases. You gain additional options when Inscribing wards:

ul.li: Choose a damage type. The Bearer gains resistance to damage of that type
Choose an ability, whenever the Bearer makes an ability check or saving throw for that ability, they can add a d4 to the roll.
When you choose a damage type for the Bearer to ignore resistances of, it also now ignores immunities to that damage type.
Choose an Artificer cantrip. The Bearer can cast that cantrip using Intelligence as their spellcasting ability.

description.p: Additionally, the d4 from your Disrupting Sigil ability increases to a d6.

description.p: Your mastery with defensive sigilry enables you to create a perpetual shield around warded creatures. Each of your wards provides its Bearer with a pool of extra HP equal to your artificer level. Whenever the bearer would take damage they can choose to use the Wards HP. The ward doesn't have the same immunities and resistances as you, it is resistant to poison and force damage and nothing else.
Additionally, the d6 from your Disrupting Sigil feature increases to a d8.
